resources.string: This is a summary of the topic.

calculate_ATGC_number_frequency : it helps us calculate the total number of A, T, G and C nucleotides in a given genomic sequence and further provides their frequency. Input to this should be a file containing the sequence (spanning multiple lines or in a single line).
GC_percentage: Calculates the GC percentage of the input DNA sequence. Input sequence should be in a file in either a single line or in multiple lines.

rev_complement : This generates the reverse complement of an input sequence present in a file. If multiple sequences are present (separated by newline (\n)), then their reverse complement will be on new lines for each sequence.

DNA_cutting: it extracts the portion of DNA around a particular position within a DNA sequence. It takes as input the sequence in a file (single line or multi-lined), the position around which we need to extract the DNA, a start position (upstream to the extraction position) and an end position (downstream to the extraction position).
Molality refers to the number of moles of solute per kilogram of solvent. Its a measure of concentration in a solution.
Molarity, on the other hand, is the number of moles of solute per liter of solution. It quantifies the concentration in a given volume.

Normality (N) is a measure of the concentration of a solute in a solution, specifically in terms of its chemical equivalents per liter of solution. It takes into account the chemical reactivity of the solute.

Dilution is the process of reducing the concentration of a solute in a solution by adding more solvent. It results in a decrease in the number of solute particles per unit volume while maintaining the total amount of solute.
